definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: China and Africa have long-lasting political instability, several mutinies and coups.
sentences.chinese: 中非政局曾长期持续动荡，多次发生兵变和政变。

sentences.english: Europe and Asia are also suffering through financial turmoil, McCormick said. (See “World Markets Remain Hesitant Following Financial Rescue Plan.”)
sentences.chinese: 麦考密克说，欧洲与亚洲也因金融动荡受害。

sentences.english: Up to 100 people have been killed in the unrest which shows no sign of subsiding.
sentences.chinese: 多达100在看不到平息下来的动荡中死亡。

sentences.english: Yet today, these markets are unraveling.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在，市场正在动荡。

sentences.english: The president was alarmed by the drift toward catastrophe in europe.
sentences.chinese: 总统对欧洲动荡的时局甚为担忧。

sentences.english: Behind this jolt was one of the world's most concentrated property bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 在这场动荡背后是世界上最严重的楼市泡沫之一。

sentences.english: These issues will be prime movers in the currency markets as unrest expands.
sentences.chinese: 随着动荡局面加剧，这些问题将是汇市的主推手。

sentences.english: In light of the recent financial disturbances, some people think so.
sentences.chinese: 由于近来的金融动荡，一些人这样认为。

sentences.english: The course has been extremely volatile since 2007, up and down.
sentences.chinese: 自从2007年以来的过程是非常动荡的，大起大伏。

sentences.english: College life may never be this tumultuous, but then again, this is TV.
sentences.chinese: 大学生活本不应该动动荡荡，仅仅体现在荧屏上。

sentences.english: Wen Jiabao held that the current international situations are not free from complexity, uncertainties and turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝表示，当前国际形势复杂和动荡不安。

sentences.english: I see unquiet ghosts and speak their whispered tongue.
sentences.chinese: 我看见动荡的鬼魂和他们低声的耳语。

sentences.english: In the late Qing Dynasty, along with the social several unrest, the performance becomed even more apparent.
sentences.chinese: 晚清时期，随着社会动荡的加剧，这种表现更加明显。

sentences.english: The world situation is characterized by turbulence and intranquility.
The shift is roiling markets around the world.
sentences.chinese: 这次动荡搅浑了世界市场。

sentences.english: In the post-vote unrest, 20 people were killed and many others were injured.
sentences.chinese: 在选举之后的动荡中，有20人丧生，许多人受伤。

definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
